column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#Text=Rameswaram
#Text=Rameswaram
#Text=is a town on Pamban Island , in the southeast Indian state of Tamil Nadu .
#Text=It 's known for Ramanathaswamy Temple , a Hindu pilgrimage site with ornate corridors , huge sculpted pillars and sacred water tanks .
#Text=It is separated from mainland India by the Pamban channel and is about 40 km from Mannar Island in Sri Lanka .
#Text=It is in the Gulf of Mannar , at the tip of the Indian peninsula .
#Text=Pamban Island , also known as Rameswaram Island , is connected to mainland India by the Pamban Bridge .
#Text=Together with Varanasi , it is considered to be one of the holiest places in India to Hindus , and part of the Char Dham pilgrimage .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Nearest airport in Madurai - 174 km from Rameswaram .
#Text=Most of the major Indian cities have daily flights here .
#Text=By train
#Text=Being a significant pilgrimage site , Rameswaram ( RMM ) is connected to all major south Indian cities like Kochi , Chennai , Hyderabad and Bengaluru .
#Text=But you might find it difficult to find a direct train till here from north Indian cities .
#Text=By road
#Text=Connected with all important towns of Tamil Nadu , City Buses are available including night services .
#Text=Point to Point services , Tourist taxi , auto / cycle rickshaws and horse carts are also available .
#Text=The taxi charges for a small car ( Indica ) is around ₹5 per km .
#Text=It costs around ₹1800 for return trip from Madurai to Rameswaram .
#Text=Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport corporation ( APSRTC ) operates Rameswaram – Tirupathi daily service .
#Text=See
#Text=Sri Ramanathaswamy Temple
#Text=( near the sea on the eastern side of the island ) .
#Text=Renowned for its magnificent prakaras or corridors with massive sculptured pillars on either side .
#Text=The longest corridor in the world is here , long and wide .
#Text=The temple has a Gopuram tall .
#Text=Different rulers built the temple as it stands today , at different periods from the 12th century AD .
#Text=There many guides who will attack as soon as you enter the temple premises ; negotiate the deal of how much to pay them if you need their services .

#Text=The history of the temple is linked with " Ramayan " and it is believed that the deity was installed by Lord Rama after the war with Ravana at the instance of the great saints to get rid of the " Brahma Dosham " .

column1: #Text=Agnitheertham
#Text=.
#Text=Sri Ramanathaswamy temple faces east .
#Text=The seashore , about from the main entrance of the temple , is very calm and therefore ideal for bathing .
#Text=The water at this place is considered sacred and known as Agni theertham .
#Text=Pilgrims perform poojas in honour of their ancestors at this seashore .
#Text=Annai Indira Gandhi Road Bridge
#Text=( Pamban Bridge ) ( 12 km ) .
#Text=Connects the Rameswaram island with the mainland .
#Text=It is the longest sea bridge in India , nearly long , and stands as a fine example of Indian architecture .
#Text=The islands near by and parallel rail bridge below can be viewed from this bridge .
#Text=Badrakaliamman Temple
#Text=( 2 km from the main temple on the way to the Gandamadana Parvatham . ) .
#Text=A temple for Devi Durga
#Text=Dhanushkodi
#Text=( 18 km ) . the southern tip of the island , Dhanushkodi was completely washed away by the 1964 cyclone .
#Text=This is a strip of land about wide and long on the eastern end of Rameswaram island .
#Text=On one side are the waters of the Indian Ocean and on the other is the Bay of Bengal .
#Text=The two seas , otherwise known as Ratnakaran and Mahodadhi , with their confluence is shaped like a bow while the strip of land resemble an arrow poised for release .
#Text=Devout Hindus consider the Adi Sethu , or the arrowhead , a sacred place to perform religious rites .
#Text=It is also a place worth visiting for its scenic beauty and bird life .
#Text=The Five-faced Hanuman Temple
#Text=( 2 km from the main temple ) . the deity of Hanuman drawn withsenthooram .
#Text=Idols of Lord Ram , Sita and Hanuman brought from Dhanushkodi during the 1964 cyclone were placed here .
#Text=The floating stone , used to build the SethuBandanamor , the bridge between India and Lanka , can be found in this temple .
#Text=Gandamadana Parvatham
#Text=. is a hillock situated 3 km away and is the highest point in the island .
#Text=Here one can see the imprint of Lord Rama ’s feet on a chakra .
#Text=The entire island of Rameswaram is visible from this point .
#Text=Jada Theertham
#Text=( about 3.5 km from Rameswaram on the Dhanushkodi road ) .
#Text=legend has it that Lord Rama , on his way back after killing Ravana , Worshipped SriRamalinga ( believed to be installed by him ) .
#Text=Before doing so , he washed his hair in this theertham to purify himself .
#Text=Kalam House
#Text=, Mosque Street .
#Text=The former President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam House is an interesting place to visit .
#Text=At present , his residence has been converted into a museum that stocks his childhood memoirs .
#Text=The place is ideal to get a glimpse into the extraordinary life of this simple man , right from childhood to his research days .
#Text=Several pictures and awards of Dr. Kalam are kept on display in this two-story building , which is maintained by his elder brother .
#Text=Moreover , a section of the house has been turned into a store that sells a variety of merchandise .
#Text=Kalam Memorial
#Text=( on the main approach road to the island ) .
#Text=A very beautiful and grand building .
#Text=It was inaugurated on the second death anniversary of Dr Kalam .
#Text=A must-visit .
#Text=No photography is allowed inside the main halls .
#Text=No entry fee .
#Text=Kothanda RamaSwamy Temple
#Text=( 12 km away from Rameswaram ) .
#Text=A popular belief is that Vibishana , brother of Ravana , surrendered before Rama here .
#Text=Nambu Nayagiamman Temple
#Text=( 8 km from the main temple in Rameswaram on the way to Dhanushkodi . ) .
#Text=Greatly venerated by the people of Ramnad District .
#Text=Satchi Hanuman Temple
#Text=( 3 km from the main temple , on the way to the Gandamadana Parvatham . ) .
#Text=A very small roadside temple .
#Text=It is considered to be the place where Hanuman delivered the good news of finding Sita to Rama with satchi or evidence , Choodamani or the jewel that belonged to Sita
#Text=Sugreevar Temple/Theertham
#Text=( on the way to Gandamadana Parvatham near the Doordarshan Kendra . ) .
#Text=Villoondi Theertham
#Text=( 7 km from the main temple on the way to Pamban ) .
#Text=It is found inside the sea like a well where freshwater is available .
